gfxeditor.app

Class Controller

  • java.lang.Object
    • gfxeditor.app.Controller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

    public class Controller
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
    This class initializes the Graphics Editor application, defines its behavior for model-related events, generates the views and changes the model.
    See Also:
    Model

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Controller()
      Constructs a controller that links itself to a new Model, Canvas and DocumentWindow.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Controller

        public Controller()
        Constructs a controller that links itself to a new Model, Canvas and DocumentWindow. Also adds the views as GraphicsListener to the model, shows the window and loads the Nimbus look-and-feel, or Metal if the former is unavailable.

      • mousePressed

        public void mousePressed(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Performs the function of the active tool on the point where the mouse button has been pressed. If the select tool is active, shape selection is delegated to the model. Otherwise a new shape will be created at the specified point.
        Specified by:
        mousePressed in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener
        See Also:
        Model.select(Point)

      • mouseReleased

        public void mouseReleased(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Finishes the resizing of the newly created shape.
        Specified by:
        mouseReleased in interface java.awt.event.MouseListener

      • mouseDragged

        public void mouseDragged(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Resizes the newly created shape or moves the selected shape, depending on the active tool.
        Specified by:
        mouseDragged in interface java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Selects the tool selected in the tool bar. This can be a ShapeTool (prototype), a ShapeFactory, or the select tool, which is default and not represented by an object.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • loadImage

        protected static javax.swing.Icon loadImage(java.lang.String name)
        Loads a GIF file from the resources folder.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the image, without file name extension
        Returns:
        An ImageIcon containing the GIF data
        See Also:
        RES_PATH

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Deselects all shapes on Esc, or deletes the selected shape on Del and Backspace, or adds a number decorator to all shapes on Shift.
        Specified by:

        See Also:

      • valueChanged

        public void valueChanged(javax.swing.event.ListSelectionEvent e)
        Selects the shape corresponding to the selected value from the JList. Also activates the select tool in the tool bar.
        Specified by:
        valueChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
        See Also:
